fields.description:
h2. Symptoms

You'll find following warning in your atlassian-jira.log on system startup
{noformat}
2013-02-08 08:46:23,659 ajp-bio-127.0.0.1-8119-exec-3 WARN my-user 526x70x5 dysyay 192.168.181.120 /s/en_USmjkoxr-418945332/849/6/5.2.6/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:autocomplete/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:autocomplete.css [atlassian.plugin.servlet.AbstractDownloadableResource] Resource not found: Resource: /includes/ajs/layer/layer.css (null)
{noformat}

h2. Cause
There is a dull reference in jira-gadgets-plugin in atlassian-plugins.xml file:
{code}
    <web-resource key="autocomplete">
        <dependency>com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:common-lite</dependency>
        <dependency>jira.webresources:autocomplete</dependency>
        <resource type="download" name="layer.css" location="/includes/ajs/layer/layer.css">
            <param name="source" value="webContextStatic"/>
        </resource>
    </web-resource>
{code}

In fact the file /includes/ajs/layer/layer.css has been refactored to layer.less file.

h2. Fix

Fix the declaration in atlassian-plugin.xml file analogous to system-webresources-plugin.xml:
{code}
        <resource type="download" name="layer.css"
                  location="/includes/ajs/layer/${pdl.dir}layer.less">
            <param name="source" value="webContextStatic"/>
        </resource>
{code}
Do not know and do not bother to find out where comes $\{pdl.dir\}, but rest of the stuff should be the same
fields.summary: web-resource pointing to no-existing file in jira-gadgets-plugin project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31626].
  {panel}

SUMMARY:

When first clicking the "Custom" command link in the Configure Fields popup of the Create Issue dialog, only a subset of the listed components are selected by default. Clicking elsewhere to dismiss the popup treats the selected subset like a requested GUI change and modifies the underlying modal dialog.

DETAILS:

Even with a newly created user:

On first view of the "Create Issue" screen, all expected fields are visible. But if you click on the "Configure Fields" dropdown and simply select the "Custom" command link, some fields are ticked by default and others are not.

As a result, a user who clicks the picklist to see what it is, and then clicks Custom, and then clicks the modal dialog to dismiss the popup *without making deliberate changes* may involuntarily, and unexpectedly, have gui components removed from the Create Issue screen (and have that screen revision persisted) by that operation.

SOLUTION:

Clicking the "Custom" command link should not only list all relevant (i.e., currently visible) components in the popup, but should show them all as selected by default. Only explicitly unticking a box should deselect a component that was visible when the popup was invoked.
fields.summary: Create Issue dialog: Configure Fields popup: "Custom" command link: only a subset of the visible fields is checked by default. Dismissing the popup imposes that unwanted change on the dialog.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# install JIRA 4.4.5 connecting it's own database. Eg:jira4db
# start up JIRA 4.4.5
# perform some operation like create issues, transit issue etc
# install a new JIRA 5.2.1 connecting to the same JIRA's 4.4.4's database. In this case: jira4db
# start up JIRA 5.2.1 while the JIRA 4.4.5 is still running
(!) database has been upgraded to the later schema while the older JIRA is still running
# perform more activity in JIRA 4.4.5 instance without error
# restarting JIRA 4.4.4 and it will complaint that the database is on a newer version. So, JIRA 4.4.4 will no longer be accessible.

Expected behaviour: JIRA should warn user when the database is upgraded before it's being restarted to avoid data inconsistency as user might run the older version for a long time before restarting it.

This is tested with JIRA 4.4.5, 5.2.1
fields.summary: Older JIRA Can Operate Even though it's Database Has Been Upgraded

fields.description:
I have created a custom multi-select field called ‘Functionality Area’.  The values need to vary from project to project so I have created separate configuration schemes for each project for this field.

There are some values that appear in the configuration schemes for more than 1 project.  Where this is the case, and a filter is then built using the Functionality Area field as 1 of the search criteria, once the filter is saved, the filter does not work.

Symptoms:
* An error is shown against the Functionality Area field when the filter is reopened
* The field is listed twice or more when the Functionality Area field list is dropped down, i.e. as many times as the value appears in configuration schemes for the Functionality Area field.

See screenshots.
fields.summary: configuration schemes with common value cause filter search to fail

fields.description:
Issue Navigator prompts error "The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down." when conducting search on the date picker field.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a custom field type: Date Picker
# Create issues and provide some value in the customfield created
# Go to issue navigator, add search criteria on the customfield
# Select "In range" and input values at the field provided (eg: 1w to 1w 1d)
# Search and error message noticed

(i) same effect observed for when trying to search using search parameter *more than XX minutes ago* (XX = numeric value). It does not affect the other two search option which is *within the last x minute* and *date range*
fields.summary: Issue Navigator Prompt "The JIRA server could not be contacted..." When Trying to Search in Customfield Date Picker

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31617].
  {panel}

On secure/admin/TimeTrackingAdmin!default.jspa, I have the options
- pretty format "2 days 2 hours 30 minutes"
- days  "3.5d"
- hours "35.5h"

I would appreciate if an option "short pretty format" would be added:
- short pretty format "2d 2:30"

Rationale: The information in the pretty format is the most concise way to quickly understand the information provided, but the strings are very long. This leads to visual problems when displaying wide tables on narrow screens, which would be avoided in the short pretty format.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like times to be displayed in a pretty but short format.

fields.description:
When you go to _Administration > Issues > Workflows_ and edit a workflow, in the Diagram screen you have a button to add a new Status. The problem is, we can't close this screen or even find the "Save" button, because the scrollbar is enough to see the bottom of the window.

h2. Workaround

As a workaround, I need to press _F11_ (use the browser in full screen) so I could see the button, in fact, half of the button.

at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.JIoEndpoint$SocketProcessor.run(JIoEndpoint.java:312)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(Unknown Source)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Referer URL: http://parvl3021384:8080/secure/ViewProfile.jspa
{noformat}

The root cause seems to be that the "Autowatch" setting is a required setting, but when the related setting is disabled in General Configuration, the "Autowatch" setting in the user profile is disabled too and so getting a NULL value.


*Workaround*
For now, there is a workaround mentioned here in [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-31607?focusedCommentId=440070&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-440070].

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31603].
  {panel}

Jira currently has the ability to link issues together and mark the link as "blocks". If I view an issue I can see a list of issues that has a direct blocks/blocked by relationship with the one I'm viewing. What I can't see is issues that have an indirect link, you have to click from issue to issue memorising the state (which gets difficult when an issue is blocked by multiple other issues). 

For example if ISSUE-1 blocks ISSUE-2 blocks ISSUE-3 then viewing ISSUE-1 says "blocks ISSUE-2", viewing ISSUE-2 says "is blocked by ISSUE-1 and blocks ISSUE-3" and viewing ISSUE-3 says "is blocked by ISSUE-2".

Instead it would be useful to be able to see a list of indirect issues blocking/blocked by the one being viewed. Ideally this could be presented as a diagram as that would be much quicker to use.

Perhaps other kinds of relationships could be displayed on this graph, but this will likely not be as useful for them.

Other specification/bug trackers such as [Launchpad|https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/hardware-q-kernel-config-review#deptree] and bugzilla has both a [text tree view|https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/showdependencytree.cgi?id=12282] and a [graph view|https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/showdependencygraph.cgi?id=12282]
fields.summary: Show a graph of blocked issues

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

This issue is not going to be addressed by the JIRA development team, but I wanted to provide some more detail about why. Most of the use cases described here are based on the desire to run arbitrary scripts in JIRA Cloud. Unfortunately, for security and performance reasons, this is something that we absolutely cannot support.

We have made significant investments in JIRA webhooks and the JIRA REST API in order to support executing the exact same actions remotely. Since we introduced [Atlassian Connect|http://connect.atlassian.com] in March 2013, *this is the recommended integration architecture for Atlassian's Cloud applications*. We have introduced a number of new REST API resources, with more coming in JIRA 7.0. There is also a new [admin UI for administering and registering webhooks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Webhooks].

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Many customers would like to implement an auto-close function similar to the one implemented on support.atlassian.com, but the one implemented by Atlassian requires the use of Jelly scripts, which are rightly banned from Cloud Applications as they have the potential to cause havoc or even allow a malicious user to perform a privilege escalation. However, the same function could be implemented by using Listeners to trigger a function, (such as the one in the bundled JIRA Toolkit plugin), so this feature request is to consider whether permitting any Listener functionality would be possible for Cloud Applications instances.
fields.summary: Allow the use of Listeners in a future version of Cloud Applications

In IE9, when using the JIRA Issue Navigator, the columns are sometimes misplaced. (The issue type is in the Issue Key column, the Issue Key is in the description column, and so on)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Using IE9, access the Issue Navigator
# Browse a few pages of the issue results
# Issue appears :

!IE9 issue navigator.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Findings

* Problem doesn't seem to be triggered by anything
* At first glance, the issue navigator appears fine. However, as the user browses more pages, the problem starts to manifest. Even if the user returns to the first page of the results, problem persists

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31581].
  {panel}

We have several customers that collect "common hours" such as vacations and meetings on the same issue for all employees. This means that the history of these issues grows very big (thousands of changes).

We have noticed that adding hours to these issues takes a good deal longer than adding hours to "new" issues (5-10 seconds, sometimes longer). We have tried both the standard "Log work" function and Tempo with the same results.

Experimenting a bit also shows that it looks like the "dispatchEvent" parameter to the "createWorklog" function is the key. Setting the "dispatchEvent" to false makes everything OK. This means that somebody that is listening to the ISSUE_WORKLOGGED_ID event is taking a long time processing.

Note that we disabled all plugins except the Atlassian plugins (see attached screenshot) which means that it's either JIRA itself or some of the listed Atlassian plugins that is the culprit.

Best regards,

Bjarni (Tempo plugin)

h5. Workaround

As a temporary workaround, the JIRA WebHooks Plugin can be disabled through the UPM.
fields.summary: Adding worklogs to issues with large histories is very slow

fields.description:
Hi,

this problem is a bit tricky. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a custom JqlFunction and implement the ClauseSanitisingJqlFunction interface so it calls SearchService#validateQuery from within sanitiseOperand
# Login to Jira
# Search using the function and ensure a query which references a stored filter is passed to SearchService#validateQuery from within sanitiseOperand
# Save as filter
# Logout without doing another search
# Login -> _silent_ crash because of stack overflow

I attached an example JqlFunction which prevents the crash by throwing an exception to provide you with a stack-trace. You can trigger it like this:
# Install plugin
# Store some search as "Test"
# Search for {code:none}executeJql("filter = Test"){code}
# Store it as e.g. "Test 2"
# Logout
# Login -> "java.lang.IllegalStateException: Already called" gets logged
# Click Issues -> 500-page with same Exception

After following the instructions you can choose to crash Jira upon next login by selecting "Test 2"-filter before logout. Selecting the filter after login works just fine.

The reason behind this seams to be a check to prevent cyclic recursion starting with the query currently stored inside the user-session.
As the user is not fully logged in, the previous query is fetched and sanitized. If it would not have been sanitized (which seams pointless at this very moment) Jira would not crash.

A possible fix could be delaying query sanitising until the user tries to retrieve the JQL/easy search parameters.

To see the real impact of this, feel free to remove the throw-statement from my example sanitizeOperand -> an instant crash which does not log any clue (at least for tomcat+war).

I regard this to be a critical flaw as this behaviour is not documented and any user-installed JQL-function could accidentally trigger it. Who checks if a function is login-save after all?

Regards

Matthias
fields.summary: Jira may crash when custom JqlFunction calls SearchService.validateQuery from within sanitiseOperand during login

Currently to change the default value (2) of number of workflow transition buttons that are visible on an issue screen, it is necessary to add/update the paramater "ops.bar.group.size.opsbar-transitions" in the file "jira-config.properties" in the JIRA home directory. 

Workflow transitions that have an "opsbar-sequence" property applied will show up in the transition button bar (<div class="toolbar-split toolbar-split-left") based on the property value (priority) - until the number of buttons hit the max set by the ops.bar.group.size.opsbar-transitions parameter; all additional transitions (with or without an opsbar-sequence property) will then be listed in the "Workflow" overflow drop down.

This new feature request is to provide an admin web UI (Admin > System > User Interface > Look and Feel) to set the ops.bar.group.size.opsbar-transitions value.

Changing the ops.bar.group.size.opsbar-transitions value will require a stop / restart of JIRA. The admin UI should also contain a simple "restart" button.
fields.summary: Admin UI to control number of workflow transition buttons that are visible

fields.description:
As of the corresponding [RFC|http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2854.txt], a <html tag is required at the beginning of the HTML content in email with content-type text/html.

Currently JIRA sends notification emails without these tags that causes some spam filter engines like Spamassassin ([http://wiki.apache.org/spamassassin/Rules/HTML_MIME_NO_HTML_TAG]) to mark such messages as spam, based on scoring.

*Workaround*
As a workaround, adding the JIRA reply address to safe senders list or reducing the score of the corresponding step in your spam filter software could be a solution.
fields.summary: HTML email shall include the <html> tag

When a user accesses an Issue Collector associated with a website using Internet Explorer 8 and try to attach any type of file, the button 'submit' is disabled and does not work.

This only happens with IE8. Works fine on all other supporte browsers.

The submit button should be enabled after attaching a screenshot.

I'm logging an improvement request on behalf of customer as per following:

{quote}
*    The mapping between source and target fields can be defined in the configuration (e.g. source field xxx -> target field yyy).
*    The mapping between source and target values can be defined in the configuration for enumerations (e.g. source option "abc" in field xxx -> target option "def" in field yyy).
*    For mandatory target fields that have no source equivalent, the user should be able to provide a target value at copy-time.
*    For optional target fields that have no source equivalent, it should be possible in the configuration to define whether the user can or cannot provide a target value at copy-time.

The way to think of this is that the plugin is similar to the jira import tool, which allows you to map from columns to fields in a fairly flexible way.

The mapping also has to be per field configuration scheme, since it may be different for projects/issue types with different schemes.
{quote}

SAC:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-150131
fields.summary: Improvement request for JIRA to JIRA issue copy plugin

2013-02-01 14:14:11,077 QuartzWorker-1 INFO ServiceRunner VCS Update Service [jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl] Parsing log.
{code}

Apart from that, the logging messages in the VCS Update Service are obviously useless. It would be great to get the option to hide all Info messages in a comfortable way.

h3. Workaround
Add this line to the log4j.properties, to increase the logging threshold for this class to WARN (that means anything at WARN, ERROR or FATAL for jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl will be logged, but INFO will not):
*log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl=WARN*
fields.summary: Improve logging of com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl

fields.description:
I was cleaning up our version history, deleting ones that there were no associated issues or archiving them if there were.  I tried to delete a couple and kept getting a message about what to do with related issues (what to swap them to).  But, if you navigate to all issues for the version, there are none.  Am concerned that there may be some data corruption/data integrity issues if the system believes that there are issues, when the user cannot see any. 
This is a db that was administered by ondemand and was just moved to onpremise. However, this was occurring before we moved it.
fields.summary: Receive message of related issues when deleting a version, but no issues exist

fields.description:
Changes to the names of Screen Tabs through the UI are not saved consistently to the database.
1) Open new browser session and log in JIRA as Administrator
2) Go to Administration -> Screens
3) Go to Configure of a non-default screen
4) Write to a side-note the Screen ID - check the URL for ConfigureFieldScreen.jspa?id=???, where ??? is the Screen ID
4) Edit the name of a Screen Tab
5) Go to Administration -> Indexing and reindex JIRA (just in case)
6) Close all browser windows / sessions (just in case)
7) Backup the database to a XML (ZIP)
8) Open the entities.xml and search for "FieldScreenTab", find the appropriate Screen ID (the same as from your side-note)
9) The Field Tab name is not changed
10) The changes are persistent in the UI until you copy the Screen. After such operation all renamed screen field tabs get reverted

The problem persists even after a restart.

h3. Workaround
Copy the screen and save it with another name.
fields.summary: FieldScreenTab configuration not saved consistently to database

fields.description:
When JIRA is using more than one User Directory, the user count can get incorrect after User Directories are removed and added a few number of times.

I'm not sure how JIRA is counting users toward the license today, but I believe the following query should return the most correct user count.

{code:SQL}
SELECT distinct u.lower_user_name
FROM cwd_user u
JOIN cwd_membership m
ON u.id = m.child_id
AND u.directory_id = m.directory_id
JOIN schemepermissions sp
ON LOWER(m.parent_name) = LOWER(sp.perm_parameter)
JOIN cwd_directory d
ON m.directory_id = d.id
WHERE sp.permission IN ('0','1','44') AND d.active = '1' and u.active = '1';
{code}

The query may need some changing considering nested groups.
fields.summary: User count toward license is not correct in JIRA

fields.description:
If attempting to open config.bat via double-click, the DOS prompt will disappear without launching the Configuration Tool. However, if you run config.bat from the command prompt you will receive the error attached.

Resolution: Edit config.bat and surround the *last* instance of *%_RUNJAVA%* with quotes, then run config.bat normally (if you used JAVA_HOME, also surround the *first* instance of *%JAVA_HOME%* with quotes)
fields.summary: Config.bat fails after setting JRE_HOME or JAVA_HOME to a path that contains a space

fields.description:
Hi,

The users can work without problems with a JIRA located in the intranet. They have not access to the Internet. But the workflow designer shows a proxy authentication dialog every time that the workflow is edited (and the Flash Player loaded), even the workflow can be edited and saved.

Why does this dialog pop up? Is there any way to avoid it be displayed? As the rest of the JIRA pages work fine (without displaying any annoying dialog), I think this is a bug. The dialog should not be shown.

Regards,
Pablo.

+Suggestion+

- Having an option to determine major version and minor version.

fields.description:
1. problem summary:
      Added a MS Active directory ldap user store with the option "Read-only with local group" and add some users to jira-administrators local group, then these ldap users can login to Jira without problem if the DB is the internal HSQLDB database. Otherwise if the DB is external Oracle 11g db, then the same ldap user cannot login.

2. steps to replicate the problem:
   a. install JIRA win32 installer on 32bit Windows 2008 server standard version (VM running on ESX4 or ESX5 server in my case) with a Eval license.
 
   b. configure the database as an external Oracle 11g DB (make sure you see Jira tables populated to the DB without showing error)
 
   c. add a Microsoft Active Directory LDAP user directory with the "Read only, with local group" option.
 
   d. add some of your ldap domain users to Jira groups like "Jira-administrators"
   e. try to login to Jira (the "http://localhost:8080" page) and verify you either fail to login or crash the webpage

   Note: if at step b you configure the database as the internal HSQLDB, then the ldap user will be able to login at step e.
fields.summary: MS Active Directory LDAP users cannot login to Jira 5.2.5 if the DB is connected to an external Oracle 11g database
Subtask as "Default" on Issue Type Scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31523].
{panel}
If the incoming emails has embedded images and with *content ID* in the email body, for example:
{noformat}
Email body 
[cid:image001.jpg@01CDFF88.D12EE900]
{noformat}
Those *CID* will be displayed in the issues description with the newly created issues.

*Steps to Reproduce*:
 # Open Outlook 2010, create a new email, drag and drop any image from the browser to Outlook or copy any image from the browser and paste into the email body in Outlook, see : [http://community.office365.com/en-us/forums/161/t/57207.aspx]
 # Send the email to the JIRA instance to create an issue.

*Expected Behavior*:
The issue is created and the images attached to the ticket. The issue description *should* only contains the email body *without* any weird strings.

*Actual Behavior*:
The issue is created and the images attached to the ticket. The issue description *contains* the CID for the images, i.e:
{noformat}
Email body 
[cid:image001.jpg@01CDFF88.D12EE900]
{noformat}
*Workaround*:

The JEMH now features a workaround for this:

[https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.javahollic.jira.jemh-ui]

Alternatively, use the [Insert|http://www.lytebyte.com/2009/08/03/how-to-insert-a-picture-or-image-inline-in-outlook-instead-as-attachment/] button in Outlook instead of 'drag and drop' or 'copy-paste'. Another way, is to include the images as attachments.
fields.summary: Emails with embedded images with content ID (CID) in the email body, it will be displayed in created issues description
